facts.text: Appeal is C.A. No. 1052 of 1971 by special leave from judgment dated May 27, 1971 of Punjab and Haryana High Court in Execution Second Appeal No. 1783 of 1970.

anchor.surface_text: CIVIL APPELLATE JURISDICTION C.A. No. 1052 of 1971. Appeal by special leave from the judgment and order dated May 27, 1971 of the Punjab and Haryana High Court in Execu- tion Second Appeal No. 1783 of 1970.

facts.text: Respondent leased building to appellant on monthly tenancy on 1st November 1959.

anchor.surface_text: The respondent who was companystructing a building, had leased it out on a monthly tenancy to the appellant on the 1st November 1959.

facts.text: Building was completed in March 1960.

anchor.surface_text: The building was ulti- mately companypleted in March 1960.

facts.text: Respondent filed suit on 14-1-1963 and got decree for ejectment on 14-8-1969.

anchor.surface_text: On 14-1-1963 he filed a suit and got a decree for ejectment on 14-8-1969.

facts.text: Execution petition filed on 29-8-1969.

anchor.surface_text: On 29-8- 1969 he filed an execution petition

facts.text: Executing court dismissed execution petition on 16-4-1970 on ground that conditions of Punjab Government notification dated 30-7-1965 under section 3 of Punjab Urban Rent Restriction Act 1949 not complied with.

anchor.surface_text: but the executing companyrt dismissed it on 16-4-1970 on the ground that the companyditions prescribed in the numberification of the Government of Punjab under section 3 of the Punjab Urban Rent Restriction Act 1949  hereinafter called the Act  dated 30-7-1965, exempting such decrees from section 13 of the said Act were number companyplied with.

facts.text: Appeal against executing court judgment was unsuccessful.

anchor.surface_text: An appeal against this judgment was unsuccessful.

facts.text: High Court in second appeal held decree executable as exempted under notification.

anchor.surface_text: On a second appeal the High Court held that the decree was executable inasmuch as that decree was exempted under the numberification.

facts.text: Government of Punjab notification dated 30-7-1965 under section 3 of Punjab Urban Rent Restriction Act 1949 exempting decrees for ejectment from section 13 for buildings constructed 1959-1963 if suits instituted during 5 years from completion.

anchor.surface_text: the numberification with which we are number companycerned was issued on 30-7-1965 and is in the following terms- In exercise of the powers companyferred by section 3 of the Punjab Urban-Rent Restriction Act 1949

facts.text: First notification issued on 8th March 1951 exempting buildings constructed 1951-1952 for 5 years from completion.

anchor.surface_text: the first numberification it appears having been issued on the 8th March 1951 which exempted buildings companystructed in 1951 and 1952 from the provisions of the Act for a period of 5. years with effect from the date of companypletion of any such building.

facts.text: Suit filed on 14th January 1963 before expiry of 5 years from building completion in March 1960.

anchor.surface_text: There is numberdoubt, from the facts set out above, the building in respect of which exemption from the application of section 13 is being claimed, was companypleted in March 1960 and a suit had also been filed on 14th January 1963 before the expiry of the period of 5 years from that date.

facts.text: Decree passed on 14th August 1969 after 5 years from construction.

anchor.surface_text: It is companytended by the learned Advocate for the appellant that the decree in that suit having been passed on 14th August 1969 after the period of 5 years from the date of companystruction

facts.text: Appellant contends exemption not available because decree passed after 5 years from construction.

facts.text: Court holds that filing suit within 5 years is sufficient for exemption, decree can be after.

anchor.surface_text: It is clear to our minds, as it was to the High Court that under clause b  the filing-of the suit within the period of exemption is the- only- companydition that is necessary to satisfy one of the requirements of the. exemption

facts.text: Earlier notifications exempted buildings up to 31-12-1963 and another for 5 years from completion.

anchor.surface_text: These buildings had already been exempted, from the pro- visions of section 13 by two earlier numberifications, the first one in 1960 giving exemption upto 31-12-1963 and the second in 1963 for 5 years from the date of companypletion of the building.

facts.text: Punjab Urban Rent Restriction Act 1949 empowers government under section 3 to direct provisions not apply to particular buildings.

anchor.surface_text: The Government under section has been empowered to, direct that all or any of the provisions of the Act shall number apply to any particular building. or rented land or any class of building or rented lands.

facts.text: High Court construction of notification accepted by Supreme Court.

anchor.surface_text: In the view we have taken, the companystruction placed by the High Court is the only companystruction that is possible on the language of the numberification.

facts.text: Buildings constructed 1959-1963 exempted for 5 years from completion if suits instituted then.

anchor.surface_text: Buildings companystructed during the years 1959, 1960, 1961, 1962 and 1963 are exempted from all the provisions of the said Act for a period of five years to be calculated from the dates of their companypletion

In doing so, we must always presume that the impugned provision was designed to effectuate a particular object or to meet a particular requirement and number that it was intended to negative that which it sought to achieve.

issues.text: Whether the exemption from section 13 of the Punjab Urban Rent Restriction Act, 1949 under the notification dated 30-7-1965 applies to a decree for ejectment passed after the five-year exemption period where the suit was instituted within that period

anchor.surface_text: It is contended by the learned Advocate for the appellant that the decree in that suit having been passed on 14th August 1969 after the period of 5 years from the date of construction, the exemption from the restrictions placed by section 13 will not be available, because according to him not only the suit should be filed but the decree for eviction should be obtained within the said period of 5 years.

arguments.claim: Exemption from section 13 under the 1965 notification not available because decree passed after 5 years from construction; both suit and decree must be obtained within 5 years.

anchor.surface_text: It is contended by the learned Advocate for the appellant that the decree in that suit having been passed on 14th August 1969 after the period of 5 years from the date of construction, the exemption from the restrictions placed by section 13 will not be available, because according to him not only the suit should be filed but the decree for eviction should be obtained within the said period of 5 years.

arguments.court_reasoning: Contention leads to incongruity, nullifies purpose of exemption, creates absurdity (e.g., suit on last day cannot yield immediate decree), and ignores that only suit filing time specified.

arguments.claim: Conditions prescribed in the 1965 notification under section 3 exempting decrees from section 13 not complied with.

arguments.claim: Words 'were or are' in clause (b) indicate suits filed or to be filed during exemption period, and decrees passed or to be passed (even after period).

anchor.surface_text: The learned Advocate for the respondent has suggested a construction which is consistent with our reading of the notification and that is that the words were or are used in clause (b) both in respect of the filing of the suits and the passing of the decrees would indicate that these suits should have been filed or are hereafter to be filed and likewise decrees of ejectment had been passed or are hereafter to be passed.

court_response_anchor.surface_text: hereafter,. as that would be the result, if the companytention that both the, suit and the, decree should be passed within the period of exemption, is

arguments.court_reasoning: Consistent with court's reading; necessary due to timing of notification relative to building completion dates.

arguments.claim: Notification must be interpreted to ascertain legislative intendment and effectuate object of granting inducement for construction via 5-year exemption.

anchor.surface_text: This contention on the very face of it would lead to incongruity or would, if accepted, have the effect of nullifying the very purpose for which the exemption was being given. We were reminded with a somewhat emphatic assertion what appears to us to be unexceptional that the Courts are not concerned with the policy of the legislature or with the result, whether injurious or otherwise, by giving effect to the language used nor is it the function of the Court where the meaning is clear not to give effect to it merely because it would lead to hardship.

arguments.claim: Exemption applies to decrees from suits instituted during 5-year period; suit filing within period is only time condition, decree can follow later.

anchor.surface_text: It is clear to our minds, as it was to the High Court that under clause (b) the filing-of the suit within the period of exemption is the only condition that is necessary to satisfy one of the requirements of the exemption, the other requirement being the passing of the decree in respect of which no time has been prescribed.

arguments.claim: Requiring decree within 5 years absurd, e.g., suit filed on last day of exemption cannot yield immediate decree.

anchor.surface_text: Taking the typical case of a building constructed in 1961, the period of 5 years exemption would expire in 1966 and under the first part of clause (b) it would be open to the landlord to file a suit for ejectment even on the last day of the expiry of the 5 years exemption. If so, it would be absurd to postulate that a decree would be given immediately thereafter.

arguments.claim: No need to specify suit filing time if decree also required within period, as exemption concerns decree not suit.

anchor.surface_text: If the decree, as contended by the learned Advocate for the appellant, has to be obtained within the period of 5 years, there was no need to specify that the suit had to be filed within that period because the exemption from the requirements of section 13 is only in respect of the decree and not the suit.

holdings.text: It is clear to our minds, as it was to the High Court that under clause b the filing-of the suit within the period of exemption is the only condition that is necessary to satisfy one of the requirements of the exemption, the other requirement being the passing of the decree in respect of which no time has been prescribed.

anchor.surface_text: It is clear to our minds, as it was to the High Court that under clause b  the filing-of the suit within the period of exemption is the- only- condition that is necessary to satisfy one of the requirements of the. exemption

holdings.reasoning_summary: Textual analysis of clause (b) specifies time only for suit institution; no time for decree; purposive interpretation avoids absurdity (suit on last day cannot get immediate decree), effectuates object of incentivizing construction via temporary exemption from rent control.

holdings.text: In the view we have taken, the construction placed by the High Court is the only construction that is possible on the language of the notification.

anchor.surface_text: In the view we have taken, the construction placed by the High Court is the only construction that is possible on the language of the notification.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Agrees with High Court's interpretation after independent textual and purposive analysis confirming suit filing within exemption period suffices for decree executability without section 13 restrictions.

holdings.text: The decree was executable inasmuch as that decree was exempted under the notification.

anchor.surface_text: On a second appeal the High Court held that the decree was executable inasmuch as that decree was exempted under the notification.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Application of notification clause (b) to facts: suit instituted 14-1-1963 within 5 years from March 1960 completion satisfies exemption condition for ejectment decree despite passage on 14-8-1969.

anchor.surface_text: In the view we have taken, the construction placed by the High Court is the only construction that is possible on the language of the notification.

outcome.relief_summary: High Court construction of notification upheld; exemption from section 13 applies to decree since suit filed within 5 years of building completion
